label: 課口
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Called also kachō. A man on whom the following taxes could be levied: tribute in kind (chō ), regular annual forced labor (edachi) or the commuted tax (yō ), and additional forced labor (yōeki ). These taxable males were divided into three main classes, namely, first-class males (seichō ), second-class males (jichō ), and third-class males (chūnan ). The amount of taxes the men of these three classes paid was in the ratio of 4-2-1. [課丁、調、役、庸、徭役、正丁、次丁、中男]
